∗17.42. Let G be a simple algebraic group of adjoint type over the algebraic closure F̄p of a finite field Fp of prime order p, and σ a Frobenius map (that is, a surjective homomorphism such that Gσ = CG(σ) is finite). Then G = Op′(Gσ) is a finite group of Lie type. For a maximal σ-stable torus T of G, let N = NG(T) ∩ G. Assume also that G is simple and G ̸∼= SL3(2). Does there always exist x ∈ G such that N ∩ N^x is a p-group?
E. P. Vdovin
∗A definitive answer for a stronger question on the size of a base has been obtained in (T. C. Burness, A. R. Thomas, J. Algebra, 619 (2023), 459–504), which implies the following answer (in the notation therein): there is x ∈ G such that N ∩ N^x is a p-group if and only if (G, N) is not one of the following: (L3(2), 7:3), (U4(2), 33:S4), (U5(2), 34:S5).
answer: There is x ∈ G such that N ∩ N^x is a p-group if and only if (G, N) is not one of the following: (L3(2), 7:3), (U4(2), 33:S4), (U5(2), 34:S5).
